oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Grand Army of the Republic (GAR) tax receipt
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A receipt acknowledging $6.60 received of James George for per capita tax on GAR Post 32 for the 1st and 2nd quarter of 1886. On the receipt is an image of African Americans picking cotton. A small note at the bottom of the receipt reads "Marshall & Bruce Stationers, Nashville, Tenn." The GAR apparently supported its organization and national programs by means of such levies on membership. George served in Co. B (later Co. A), 1st Tenn. Inf. Regt., USA.
